en.new_game_plus_description: Congratulations! Through the purchase of your 25th Legacy Perk you have unlocked the opportunity to activate NEW GAME PLUS. This mode will reset your game like prestige but you will also lose your Legacy Perks acquired (you will keep your stats and achievements obtained so far). In return you will get a +1% bonus to all caps and +0.1% bonus to all production for each Legacy Perk you have lost. Each time you activate NEW GAME PLUS, you will also halve the time required for all exploration, espionage, and attack missions
en.new_game_plus_confirm_1: This is the NEW GAME PLUS mode. Each time you perform a NG+ you will get a permanent bonus of 1% to all caps and 0.1% to all production for each Legacy Perks you had obtained in this game series. For each NG+ you have halved the time required for exploration, espionage, and attack missions. ##### THE NG+ RESETS ALL PROGRESS MADE SO FAR (EXCEPT ACHIEVEMENTS AND STATS) AND RESTARTS A NEW GAME #####
en.new_game_plus_confirm_2: This will reset ALL your progress in this game
en.new_game_plus_confirm_3: Do you understand what will happen? THE NG+ RESETS ALL PROGRESS MADE SO FAR (EXCEPT ACHIEVEMENTS AND STATS) AND RESTARTS A NEW GAME

en.soft_reset_confirm_1: This is a form of prestige. Each time you perform a prestige you will get a permanent bonus to any production and gain Legacy points (from your Fame) that you can spend on permanent bonuses. The prestige resets all progress made so far (except achievements, stats and legacy bonuses) and restarts a new game
en.soft_reset_confirm_2: This will reset all your progress in this game
en.soft_reset_confirm_3: Do you understand what will happen?
en.soft_reset_2_confirm: Are you ready to stop the army of the dead? Theresmore and its kingdoms are counting on you for their survival
en.soft_reset_description_1_true: Glorious retirement is Theresmore's first form of prestige. Each time you perform a prestige you will get a permanent bonus to any production and gain Legacy points (from your Fame) that you can spend on the permanent bonuses you see below. The prestige resets all progress made so far (except achievements, stats and legacy bonuses) and restarts a new game
en.soft_reset_description_2_true: You have defeated the army of the dead and Theresmore is saved from the undead scourge. Beating them you got 1 RELIC. You can continue playing or choose to prestige thanks to your glorious victory! Each time you perform a prestige you will get a permanent bonus to any production and gain Legacy points that you can spend on the permanent bonuses you see below. The prestige resets all progress made so far (except achievements, stats and legacy bonuses) and restarts a new game
en.soft_reset_description_2_false: The army of the dead has emerged from the portal and overwhelmed your defenses and your city. One by one, all the kingdoms of Theresmore have fallen and now the land is prey to the dead. Each time you perform a prestige you will get a permanent bonus to any production and gain Legacy points that you can spend on the permanent bonuses you see below. The prestige resets all progress made so far (except achievements, stats and legacy bonuses) and restarts a new game
en.soft_reset_description_3_true: You have economically conquered all of Theresmore and no kingdom will ever escape your manipulation again. Through this prestige in addition to Legacy you will gain 1 COIN. Each time you perform a prestige you will get a permanent bonus to any production and gain Legacy points (from your Fame) that you can spend on the permanent bonuses you see below. The prestige resets all progress made so far (except achievements, stats and legacy bonuses) and restarts a new game
en.soft_reset_description_4_true: The gods welcome you into their midst, and the problems of earthly life seem only a vague memory. As for now, you can devote yourself to eternal pleasure, but soon they will need you on Theresmore. Through this prestige in addition to Legacy you will gain 1 TOME OF WISDOM. Each time you perform a prestige you will get a permanent bonus to any production and gain Legacy points that you can spend on the permanent bonuses you see below. The prestige resets all progress made so far (except achievements, stats and legacy bonuses) and restarts a new game
en.soft_reset_description_5_false: Suddenly sounds of horns, howls and battle cries shatter the stillness of the night. Soldiers rush to the defenses but goblin wolfriders are already all around them. Arrows as black as night strike the garrison and their poison acts quickly. The goblins swarm into the settlement looting and destroying everything you had so hard built. If only we had had more defenses and a stronger garrison we could have destroyed these damned green-skinned. You were defeated, but that's not the end of Theresmore! Thanks to the fame you have accumulated so far, you can spend legacy point to buy special permanent perks that will help you for all the upcoming games
en.soft_reset_description_6_false: Once again our valiant soldiers will close ranks, ready to give battle. The red dragon looms over the city and its draconic servants engage in a ruthless battle on the city walls. Your soldiers fight bravely until the dragon decides to end the battle. His fiery breath destroys the ramparts annihilating anyone in his path. Entire districts of the city burn and civilians fight for their very lives. Everything is now screaming, destruction and ashes. The battle is lost. You were defeated, but that's not the end of Theresmore! Thanks to the fame you have accumulated so far, you can spend legacy point to buy special permanent perks that will help you for all the upcoming games
en.soft_reset_description_7_false: Soldiers in the city are making light of what happened when screams are heard coming from the city walls. Before long batteries of muskets are firing, and our garrison, taken by surprise, is mowed down by enemy lead. A being in armor with big black wings flies over an army of demons armed with muskets. Before destroying the city he says these words : thank you for trusting me and secretly arming my legion, now I will give you the justice that only a fallen angel possesses! You were defeated, but that's not the end of Theresmore! Thanks to the fame you have accumulated so far, you can spend legacy point to buy special permanent perks that will help you for all the upcoming games
en.soft_reset_description_8_false: Our city was ready to repel the onslaught but for all the gods those monstrosities were too much for any Theresmore army. First they swarmed toward the city the lesser demons that gasped fire and incinerated our defenses, finally at a command from the Fallen Angel they charged the greater demons. Ten-foot-tall monsters hurled helpless soldiers into the air and others were mauled by those abominations. The Fallen Angel laughed and the laughter of his vengeance could be heard throughout the city. You were defeated, but that's not the end of Theresmore! Thanks to the fame you have accumulated so far, you can spend legacy point to buy special permanent perks that will help you for all the upcoming games
en.soft_reset_description_9_false: The once proud fortresses of the Orcish nation lay in ruins, and the horde set out on a final, desperate charge. With fire in their eyes and weapons in their hands, they launched themselves against our walls, seeking to break through. The armies of the free peoples, honed by centuries of battle against the most fearsome foes, stood their ground and battled the orcs for days. The fate of the free and the bloodthirsty hung in the balance, and the outcome was uncertain. But then, a breach was made, and the end seemed near. The humans fought with all their might, knowing that defeat would mean enslavement or worse. The orcish horde stormed forward, a relentless tide of destruction. The last bastion of freedom held fast, but eventually, with a mournful crash, it fell. Theresmore was no more, and the humans were doomed. The only thing that remained was a bitter memory of the battle, a reminder of the sacrifice made by those who fought for freedom and of the hope that had once burned bright, but now lay forever extinguished. You were defeated, but that's not the end of Theresmore! Thanks to the fame you have accumulated so far, you can spend legacy point to buy special permanent perks that will help you for all the upcoming games
en.soft_reset_description_10_false: In the depths of the Abyss, the final confrontation with the Mindless Evil began. The combined forces of humanity and their elven allies stood ready, their hearts steeled by the victories over Baron Mordecai and the Matriarch. Yet, nothing could have prepared them for the sheer malevolence that was the Mindless Evil. As the battle commenced, darkness thicker than any night enveloped the battlefield, swallowing light and hope alike. The Mindless Evil, an amorphous entity of pure chaos and hatred, moved with a terrifying, fluid grace. Its presence warped reality, driving soldiers to madness with its mere proximity. Spells of light and fire seemed to flicker and die in the face of its consuming void. Despite their bravery, the defenders of Theresmore found themselves overwhelmed. The eldritch horrors of the Abyss surged forward, tearing through ranks with unrelenting ferocity. Humanity's greatest champions, alongside their elven allies, fought valiantly but were ultimately powerless against the onslaught. One by one, the brave warriors fell. The luminous beacons that had once illuminated their path flickered and went dark. The screams of the fallen were lost in the all-consuming void. Blood soaked the battlefield, and the cries of the dying echoed through the Abyss, a haunting symphony of despair. In the final moments, as the last remnants of resistance were snuffed out, a chilling silence fell over the battlefield. The Mindless Evil, victorious, spread its influence across Theresmore. The once vibrant lands were plunged into an age of darkness and despair. The great cities crumbled, and nature itself twisted under the weight of the malevolent force. The tales of their valiant struggle became whispered legends, warnings of the hubris that led to their downfall. Hope for a future free from the clutches of the Abyss dimmed, leaving behind only the shadow of what once was. The Mindless Evil, now unchallenged, reveled in its dominion over Theresmore. The surviving inhabitants, few and scattered, lived in constant fear and misery, their spirits broken. The world had been irrevocably changed, and the light of hope had been extinguished, leaving only darkness in its wake
en.soft_reset_description_11_false: Launch the Annihilator is a form of prestige. Each time you launch it you will get a permanent bonus of +4% any production, +2% fame, +2 light +2luck points and +10 to army cap. You will gain Legacy points (from your Fame) that you can spend on permanent bonuses. The prestige resets all progress made so far (except achievements, stats and legacy bonuses) and restarts a new game

en.bui_mind_shrine_description: The sanctuary dedicated to Wisdom will help us discover the secrets of Theresmore
en.bui_ministry_development_description: Our society is complex, we need ministries
en.bui_ministry_interior_description: For the internal management of our society
en.bui_ministry_worship_description: The place where worship becomes an institution
en.bui_mine_description: Do you know what they have awakened in the darkness of Khazzard-drum? Shadow and flames
en.bui_minefield_description: We mine the fields around the city
en.bui_mining_area_description: The Abyss underground is rich of minerals
en.bui_monument_description: Leftover wonder from an ancient ancestor, contains various heirlooms from the past
en.bui_natronite_baloon_description: From above we will be able to comfortably spot enemies
en.bui_natronite_depot_description: A warehouse to contain the dangerous natronite
en.bui_natronite_refinery_description: The refinery of the precious natronite
en.bui_natronite_shield_description: A natronite boost to our defense
en.bui_observatory_description: A place to observe the stars and predict events
en.bui_officer_training_ground_description: The officers of our army will get out of here
en.bui_oracle_b_description: The gods will send us signs
en.bui_palisade_description: Let's make sure that we turn our settlement into an Oppidum
en.bui_pillars_of_mana_description: A large column that recalls the mana of all Theresmore. It has a very expensive constant maintenance
en.bui_pilgrim_camp_description: The faithful who come to the new world seek a new home
en.bui_quarry_description: The quarry will supply the city with stone
en.bui_railway_station_description: It will bring gold and immigration
en.bui_rampart_description: The rampart will protect the settlement from any incursion
en.bui_reactivate_portal_description: The portal of the dead must be reactivated in order to use it
en.bui_reactivate_portal_decryption_descrip: Symbols on portals require careful study to decipher
en.bui_refinery_description: A refinery for natronite and other materials
en.bui_refugee_district_description: A district that will become a part of the city
en.bui_refugee_district_part_description: A part of the Refugees district
en.bui_regenerative_gardens_description: A green area outside the Sanctum, dedicated to cultivating medicinal herbs and healing plants
en.bui_research_plant_description: From here, researchers will discover Theresmore
en.bui_residential_block_description: A block of apartments to accommodate as many people as possible
en.bui_sacred_den_b_description: A sacred place sheltered from evil
en.bui_sanctum_healing_description: A combination of spells, alchemical knowledge, and technologies would be employed for elven genetic healing
en.bui_sawmill_description: More wood, more buildings, more production
en.bui_school_description: Fatti non foste a viver come bruti ma per seguir virtute e canoscenza
en.bui_shed_description: There is plenty of space in the colony to store goods
en.bui_siege_workshop_description: Better siege weapons for the army
en.bui_signal_machine_description: The device of the mysterious signal
en.bui_signal_machine_part_description: a part of the Signal Machine
en.bui_souls_description: The souls of scholars are absorbed by the Library of SouLs
en.bui_soulstealer_citadel_description: Infuse dark power to our army, with a great sacrifice
en.bui_spiritual_garden_description: A place of peace in contact with nature
en.bui_stable_description: In the stables you work hard and get up at dawn without ever complaining
en.bui_statue_atamar_description: Atamar, the most famous strategist of the past
en.bui_statue_firio_description: Firio, one of the greatest priests of the past
en.bui_statue_lurezia_description: Lurezia, one of the greatest sorceresses of the past
en.bui_statue_virtue_description: A huge statue to celebrate the humans of Theresmore
en.bui_statue_virtue_part_description: A part of the Statue of Virtues
en.bui_steel_mills_b_description: The sound of steel mills reverberates through Theresmore
en.bui_steel_palace_b_description: The Steel Palace shine in our city
en.bui_steel_palace_b_part_description: A part of the Steel Palace
en.bui_steelworks_description: The steelworks will produce steel from other metals
en.bui_stock_exchange_description: Where we control the goods of Theresmore
en.bui_stock_exchange_part_description: A part of the Stock Exchange
en.bui_storage_facility_description: A facility to store our productions
en.bui_stronghold_description: The colony defense and supplies are all here
en.bui_tax_revenue_checkpoints_description: A legal and systematic taxation of goods in circulation
en.bui_temple_description: The ancient gods will show us the way
en.bui_university_description: Home of the most eccentric scholars
en.bui_valley_of_plenty_description: Toss a coin to your player Oh, Valley of Plenty!
en.bui_wall_description: Why stop at a simple palisade?
en.bui_war_shrine_description: The shrine dedicated to the God of War will help us crush our enemies
en.bui_watchman_outpost_description: Placed at key points will allow you to see incoming attacks. We need four of them to progress
en.bui_the_vaults_description: A vault of stone and steel to store our gold
en.bui_titanic_walls_description: So large that they also house laboratories within them
en.bui_titanic_walls_part_description: A part of the Titanic Walls
en.bui_tower_mana_description: A tower to channel the power of sacred places
en.bui_trench_description: Barbed wire and a lot of mud
en.bui_underground_house_description: Safe from the darkness winds of madness
en.bui_underground_store_description: The battle for caps reach the Abyss
en.bui_underground_tunnel_b_description: A maze of tunnels to defend our people
en.dip_army_of_the_dead_description: The army of the dead is upon us, we must repel it and save Theresmore
en.dip_barbarian_horde_description: We subdued the barbarians and brought them civilization
en.dip_relationships_description: Your current relationships with this faction
en.dip_send_delegation_description: We send a delegation to this people to start diplomatic relations
en.dip_kobu_dominion_r_description: The entirety of the Kobu Dominion is contained within this structure. They have mechanical bodies and their technology is nearly unfathomable. Its fortunate that they no longer have any desire for war
en.dip_improve_relationships_description: We will do our best to improve relations with the target nation. The more resources you spend on improving relations the more the benefits will be
en.dip_insult_description: Son of a Theresmorian goat, your smell precedes you! This should make our relationships worse
en.dip_alliance_description: Our great nations will stand the test of time. We will now provide each other military and resource aid
en.dip_owned_description: We have conquered this faction and now all its riches are ours
en.dip_trade_agreements_description: Possible trade pacts with this faction
en.dip_war_confirm_description: Are you sure you want to go to war with this faction? It will be a ruthless conflict and you will face armies with hundreds of units. You will not be able to make peace with them again. Proceed only if you have a very good army to be able to defend and attack
en.dip_war_declaration: You are now at war with this faction, may the gods of Theresmore help us in battle to exterminate our enemies. Beware that the enemy army has been spotted near the border, they may launch an attack at any moment. Let's use our soldiers as a garrison or let's launch a terrible attack that will totally annihilate these filthy piles of dung
en.dip_relationship_unknown_description: We have not yet met this faction
en.dip_relationship_negative_description: We are on bad terms with this faction
en.dip_relationship_positive_description: We are on good terms with this faction
en.dip_relationship_neutral_description: This faction does not love or hate us
en.dip_enso_multitude_description: In the Far East there is a civilization that can rival us for primacy on Theresmore. They call themselves Enso, the enlightened ones, the very force of the universe. Their symbol is a circle, they have almond-shaped eyes and their complexion is yellowish. They invented gunpowder and their warriors are fierce in battle and swarm like a multitude over the unfortunate enemy armies. They keep vast stores of Natronite of which they are very jealous; maybe it would be better to make friends with them.
en.dip_nightdale_protectorate_description: The northern tribes are united under the protectorate of Nightdale, proud warriors, they show no fear against their enemies.
en.dip_scalerock_tribes_description: In the high peaks of the Scalerock Mountains, there are tribes of draconians. They live in caves carved into the rock and fly over the high peaks to swoop down on their unsuspecting enemies. Descendants of dragons have retained their intelligence and craftsmanship in creating objects. They know natronite, perhaps from an ancestral legacy, and are greedy for it beyond measure.
en.dip_sssarkat_empire_description: In the warm waters beyond the realm of Zultan are salamander-like creatures that live mostly underwater. They are repositories of a vanished ancient civilization and populate its ruins by making use of remaining technology. They often visit the mainland and some of their villages can be found on the sunny shores.
en.dip_theresmore_wanders_description: In the boundless plains to the east there are nomadic tribes called the wanders, we don't know how many they are and what their real strength is. The territories to the east are mostly unknown.
en.dip_western_kingdom_description: The kingdom of the west is a feudal monarchy, protected by its large castles and it's formidable on the battlefield thanks to its cavalry.
en.dip_zultan_emirate_description: Along the deserts of the south flourishing commercial cities have sprung up, the largest of these being Zultan whose oligarchy controls a vast area.
en.dip_king_kobold_nation_description: These little bipedal lizards have never been at our level. We chased them back to the dust from whence they came.
en.dip_lich_fortress_description: Nikharul undead army is a danger to all of Theresmore
en.dip_baron_mordecai_description: Baron Mordecai Darkthorn, High Vampire Lord of the Abyssal Realm
en.dip_dark_knight_lord_description: The Fire Knight is an overlord of the abyssal realm
en.dip_hand_evil_description: The Hand of Evil, Mother of all succubi, the right-hand of the ruler of the Abyss
en.ene_ancient_burial_place_description: A place long forgotten, few undeads roaming around. A few dozen of soldiers will exterminate them
en.ene_ancient_giant_description: A huge cave where an ancient giant resides with his progeny
en.ene_ancient_hideout_description: Bandits have occupied this old hideout, a few dozen of soldiers should eliminate them
en.ene_ancient_lighthouse_description: An ancient lighthouse in the Abyss
en.ene_ancient_ruin_description: In the darkness strange ruins appear
en.ene_dark_village_description: A lost village in the obscure realm. Perhaps this was once an inhabited land
en.ene_harpy_nest_description: The harpies' nest from where they attract unsuspecting travelers
en.ene_ball_lightning_field_description: A group of globular lightning bolts took over a field not far from the colony
en.ene_bandit_camp_description: Along the road and in the woods to cut up merchants and passersby, a few dozen of soldiers will take care of them
en.ene_barbarian_camp_description: A peaceful tribe of barbarian. Beware: don't poke the bear
en.ene_barbarian_village_description: A large barbarian village where multiple tribes joined together to prosper
en.ene_barren_hills_description: The barren hills are an inhospitable place inhabited by giants and kobolds
en.ene_basilisk_cave_description: The cave where basilisks roam around, they are very dangerous
en.ene_black_mage_tower_description: The tower of a dark wizard. With his goblins he is planning evil plans against Theresmore
en.ene_bugbear_tribe_description: A tribe of bugbears raiding the region from their small camp in search of loot
en.ene_bugbear_war_party_description: When a chieftain goes to war his bugbear warriors become a fearsome force to be reckoned with
en.ene_burning_pit_description: The subsoil of Theresmore is infested with demons, fortunately these are small in size
en.ene_cave_bats_description: A cave infested with vampire bats, some spearmen will eliminate them
en.ene_church_abyss_description: A dark infested church in the Abyss
en.ene_circle_necromancer_description: A Circle of Necromancer in the Abyss
en.ene_citadel_dead_description: An abandoned citadel haunted by the dead (and wyverns)
en.ene_construction_site_description: Mercenaries have taken up residence in this vast space. Let's drive them out
en.ene_corrupted_lands_description: Immortal lands lies down in agony around the now corrupted Crystal
en.ene_dark_knight_patrol_description: A few patrols of dark knights patrol the region
en.ene_deserters_den_description: The den of deserters, they respect only the god of money by now
en.ene_demoness_castle_description: A gloomy castle from which comes a strong demonic aura, there must be many demons within it
en.ene_demonic_portal_description: Near this portal there are several greater and lesser demons while in the sky flutter dozens of imp
en.ene_dense_oasis_description: The home of one of the Naga Princess. Beware!
en.ene_desecrated_temple_description: The Luna Temple has been converted into a pile of putrescence, many greenskinned humanoids are at work at this site
en.ene_djinn_palace_description: The abode of a Djinn, several nagas guard the entrance. It will be a tough battle
en.ene_east_sacred_place_description: There is a place in the east where the power of Theresmore is alive in the air, elementals guard it
en.ene_earth_elemental_circle_description: They look like the sacred places of the old continent but are much stronger
en.ene_elder_dragon_description: The shadow of Vaelgoroth loomed, its massive wings blotting out the sun, while the figure of Azrathis stood resolute, a figure wreathed in flame and ancient power
en.ene_eternal_halls_description: The Eternal Halls are a holy place for the people of the Western Kingdom. They are protected by stone guardians
en.ene_ettin_camp_description: Ettins are giant two-headed creatures. In their camp some natives are kept in cages
en.ene_ettin_enslaver_description: A ettin tribe whose main role is to trade slaves
en.ene_evil_abode_description: A lonely abode in the Abyss
en.ene_far_west_island_description: A small island a few days' sail to the west
en.ene_fire_elemental_circle_description: They look like the sacred places of the old continent but are much stronger
en.ene_fire_mage_domain_description: The molten desert is the domain of a long forgotten fire mage
en.ene_frost_elemental_circle_description: They look like the sacred places of the old continent but are much stronger
en.ene_fire_salamander_nest_description: A nest of fire salamanders, these reptiles are very dangerous when confronted near their burrows
en.ene_forgotten_shelter_description: A forgotten and sealed refuge where dark ghosts of memory lodge
en.ene_galliard_mercenary_camp_description: Captain Galliard and his company of mercenaries are stationed at this camp.
en.ene_giant_temple_description: An ancient temple hidden in the intricate forest
en.ene_gloomy_werewolf_forest_description: The forest of the werewolf is so full of obstacles that even the best equipped of armies would have difficulty
en.ene_goblin_lair_description: Goblins are dodgy creatures, they have little weaponry but poison the tips of their arrows. A few dozen of soldiers will be safe enough
en.ene_golem_cave_description: A cave full of statues. Beware they may come alive to defend it
en.ene_gold_mine_description: A large gold mine but is inhabited by trolls. A SEA of trolls. Warning!
en.ene_gorgon_cave_description: The gorgon petrifies with its gaze and lurks in an intricate cave system fraught with danger
en.ene_gnoll_camp_description: The camp reeks of carrion from several miles away. Watch out for the leader of the Gnolls
en.ene_gnoll_raiding_party_description: These human-hyena hybrids take the worst from both species
en.ene_gulud_ugdun_description: The castle where children are held captive. We have to kill Gulud
en.ene_haunted_library_description: An old library, now ghosts guard it. A few dozen of soldiers will haunt them down
en.ene_hell_hole_description: A hole in the ground that leads to a large cave. The entrance to hell
en.ene_hobgoblin_chieftain_description: A small army of Hobgoblins led by their chieftain
en.ene_hobgoblin_encampment_description: A camp full of hobgoblin grunts, their resources could come in handy
en.ene_huge_cave_description: Beneath the crypts of the Library is an immense cavern filled with skeletons
en.ene_hydra_pit_description: The pit of a hydra: it fights like a legion thanks to its five heads
en.ene_immense_door_e_description: This door guards the storehouse of the Kobu Dominion
en.ene_lead_golem_mine_description: In an old mine we discovered golems of a strange, very hard substance
en.ene_leprechaun_den_description: A Den of Leprechaun, it will bring us luck!
en.ene_lich_temple_description: The Lich is a source of dark power and commands dozens of undead
en.ene_lost_valley_description: The lost valley of elven legends
en.ene_king_reptiles_description: In a valley forgotten by time there are animals never seen before. Giant reptiles from the distant past
en.ene_kobold_city_description: A kobold city right under our feet, who knew?
en.ene_kobold_looters_description: From their small encampment they raid the nearby countryside, let's drive them off with a few soldiers
en.ene_kobold_stash_description: In the kobold stuff we might find some interesting things
en.ene_kobold_underground_tunnels_descripti: Kobolds dig their burrows deep, they are weak but very numerous
en.ene_korrigan_dolmen_description: These despicable little creatures like to prey on wayfarers near their dolmens
en.ene_markanat_forest_description: Markanat's flooded forest, a giant spider that does not allow anyone to approach
en.ene_mercenary_camp_description: Mercenaries without a patron, they are dedicated to looting and very dangerous
en.ene_minotaur_maze_description: The minotaur's labyrinth. A formidable challenge for anyone
en.ene_myconid_cavern_description: A tribe of myconids took this cave of strong magical impulse as a home
en.ene_mountain_cave_description: A huge cave from which a giant controls the mountain along with his goblin minions
en.ene_mountain_valley_description: A large valley in the middle of the mountains. It is inhabited by giants but if we can drive them out there will be plenty of food and wood
en.ene_naga_nest_description: They won't let us take their precious food sources without bloodshed
en.ene_nasty_pillagers_description: These dirty raiders had set aside some small wealth, let's send a few soldiers to dispatch them
en.ene_necromancer_crypt_description: The dreary home of a mad necromancer. Beware of the undead!
en.ene_necropolis_description: A huge Necropolis in the Abyss
en.ene_north_sacred_place_description: There is a place in the north where the power of Theresmore is alive in the air, elementals guard it
en.ene_old_herd_description: An old rat-infested pasture, a dozen soldiers should be enough
en.ene_old_outpost_description: An old abandoned outpost now the refuge of deserters, bandits and mercenaries
en.ene_old_storage_room_description: An old storage room in which spiders have nested, a dozen of spearmen will conquer this place
en.ene_orc_gormiak_citadel_description: An Orcish fortified citadel. The stench of this putrid settlement fouls the air
en.ene_orc_horith_citadel_description: The city that protects the territory of Horith, famous for the fire caster clan
en.ene_orc_ogsog_citadel_description: The fortified citadel of Ogsog from where the Orcish champions arrive
en.ene_orc_turgon_citadel_description: The citadel of Turgon where the clan of Orcish shamans originates from
en.ene_orc_raiding_party_description: An Orcish army that is putting the colony's surroundings to the sword
en.ene_orcish_prison_camp_description: A camp where orcs are holding prisoners from their raids
en.ene_prisoner_wagon_description: A wagon in which bandits trapped civilians, a few spearman with archers will eliminate them
en.ene_rat_cellar_description: A cellar infested with ravenous rats, let's bring some spearmen
en.ene_raider_hideout_description: A cave with fourty raider in it
en.ene_rusted_warehouse_description: An abandoned farmhouse that will become a good warehouse
en.ene_save_damned_description: The cries of the damned echo in the dark
en.ene_sleeping_titan_description: It seems that those who can awaken the titan will have immense gifts
en.ene_skullface_encampment_description: The skullface camp is defended by several bandits; it will not be easy to eliminate him
en.ene_smuggler_warehouse_description: A huge warehouse where the smugglers hide their things
en.ene_snakes_nest_description: Into which many unsuspecting victims have fallen
en.ene_spider_forest_description: A dense forest full of giant spider webs
en.ene_son_atamar_description: Atamar cult comes from the southern deserts, its believers are excellent swordsmen
en.ene_south_sacred_place_description: There is a place in the south where the power of Theresmore is alive in the air, elementals guard it
en.ene_strange_village_description: A village where the inhabitants have a blank stare and are very aggressive
en.ene_succubus_library_description: These demonesses have taken as their abode an obscure library. Beware of approaching
en.ene_swarm_wasp_description: An immense swarm of giant wasps roams the land
en.ene_temple_gargoyle_description: This ancient temple in the forest is guarded by several gargoyles
en.ene_troll_cave_description: A smelly cave that trolls call home, driving out the occupants will be a serious problem
en.ene_vampire_crypt_description: A crypt forgotten by time, apparently now home to vampires or servants of them
en.ene_vampire_lair_description: The home of a vampire, a terrible enemy capable of instilling fear in even the most valiant soldiers
en.ene_wind_elemental_circle_description: They look like the sacred places of the old continent but are much stronger
en.ene_west_sacred_place_description: There is a place in the west where the power of Theresmore is alive in the air, elementals guard it
en.ene_wolf_pack_description: A pack of vicious wolves attack passing flocks, a few dozen of soldiers should contain the pack
en.ene_worn_down_crypt_description: In a remote, secluded section of a spooky forest, there are a force of skeletal knights guarding the entrance to a worn down crypt
en.ene_wyvern_nest_description: These terrible creatures resemble dragons and are often mistaken for them
en.fai_accept_druid_description: Accepting the druid and his beliefs as an integral part of our society, he will become high priest
en.fai_acolyte_hymn_description: The chant of the devout rises to the gods
en.fai_ancient_spell_p_description: A spell that will help us progress
en.fai_amusement_quarter_f_description: We have to build the Amusement Quarter
en.fai_archmage_p_description: Archmages are the elite wizards on the battlefield
en.fai_armored_caravan_p_description: We must also look out for the merchants in service of our beliefs!
en.fai_army_faith_description: Armies of faith will burn our enemies
en.fai_banish_druid_description: Banish the Druid from the city, we don't need gurus
en.fai_blessing_church_description: A new ritual can be cast on the Church
en.fai_blessing_prelate_description: A blessing for the entire army
en.fai_city_blessing_description: We must gather the city's wise men and create a protection spell
en.fai_control_fortress_description: Use the power of the Dark Crystal to rebuild the Soulstealer Citadel
en.fai_create_sacred_golem_description: We will be able to create a blessed mana powered golem
en.fai_dark_ritual_description: The demonic power infused in our sacred warriors could lead to consequences
en.fai_demonology_description: We have defeated enough demons to study their characteristics
en.fai_demoniac_tome_description: We have to translate the tome to find out its origin
en.fai_desire_abundance_description: Desire for abundance. Only one desire can be expressed. Choose wisely
en.fai_desire_magic_description: Desire for magic. Only one desire can be expressed. Choose wisely
en.fai_desire_war_description: Subdue the Djinn so he can fight for us. Only one desire can be expressed. Choose wisely
en.fai_dragon_skull_description: The ancient artifact is a skull of a dragon! We can use its powers and create new equipment by copying its hardness
en.fai_enhanced_barracks_f_description: Zenix's training skills will take us to a new concept of barracks
en.fai_enchanted_bullet_description: Zenix know how to make our bullets lethal
en.fai_eureka_halls_f_description: We have to explore the Eureka Halls
en.fai_praise_gods_description: We must please the gods so they will listen to us
en.fai_blessing_description: The first form of power of the gods in Theresmore: blessings
en.fai_fate_shrine_f_description: We have to praise the Fate Shrine
en.fai_focus_development_description: Focus on city enhancements. Only one focus can be taken. Choose wisely
en.fai_focus_magic_description: Focus on mana production. Only one focus can be taken. Choose wisely
en.fai_focus_research_description: Focus on research. Only one focus can be taken. Choose wisely
en.fai_holy_light_description: Now we can bless our warriors with light
en.fai_hope_children_description: We rescued the children from Gulud, they have magical abilities outside the norm
en.fai_lucky_grove_f_description: We have to explore this Lucky Grove
en.fai_lucky_well_f_description: We have to exploit this Lucky Well
en.fai_pilgrim_chant_description: The faithful's song of faith creates abundance in the new world
en.fai_prayer_for_the_great_seeker_descript: A prayer for the Great Seeker, that our hunters never lose the trail
en.fai_great_seeker_2_description: We pray the Great Seeker to grant us his keen sight
en.fai_prayer_for_mother_earth_description: A prayer for our Mother Earth, that its fruits descend on us
en.fai_mother_earth_2_description: We pray to Mother Earth that she will grant us abundance
en.fai_prayer_for_the_old_small_one_descrip: A prayer for the Old Small One, that the dwarf of antiquity gives us abundance
en.fai_old_small_one_2_description: We pray to the Dwarf that he will give us his grace
en.fai_prayer_for_the_ancient_monk_descript: A prayer for the Ancient Monk, that his disciples may return to battle with us
en.fai_prayer_goddess_luck_description: A prayer for the Goddess of Luck, to inspire the fate!
en.fai_prayer_for_the_great_warrior_descrip: A prayer for the Great Warrior, that his fury guides our soldiers
en.fai_prayer_lonely_druid_description: A prayer for the Lonely Druid, that gives us his blessing
en.fai_great_warrior_2_description: We pray to the Great Warrior to give us fury on the battlefields
en.fai_prayer_for_the_great_builder_descrip: A prayer for the Great Builder, to guide our masons
en.fai_prayer_for_the_mysterious_arcane_des: A prayer for the Mysterious Arcane, to guide our wise men
en.fai_prayer_wild_man_description: A prayer for the Wild Man, to breed our tamed beasts
en.fai_wild_man_2_description: We praise the Wild Man to obtain his agility
en.fai_unveil_theresmore_description: We peer into the mysteries of Theresmore
en.fai_sacred_place_description: There are places in Theresmore where the energies of the planet converge
en.fai_strange_lamp_description: In the naga's nest we found a strange lamp like those used in southern Theresmore
en.fai_acolyte_circle_description: The prayers of these devotees will help us
en.fai_gold_consecration_description: All our faith must be directed in our project of economic domination
en.fai_gold_factory_f_description: A factory to boost gold. Only one Zenix Factory can be research. Choose wisely
en.fai_gold_trasmutation_description: Zenix ultimate spell to produce gold
en.fai_great_seeker_blessing_description: Guide our arrows to the target
en.fai_great_warrior_blessing_description: Lead our brave men into battle
en.fai_growth_nature_description: We will be able to create a spell to thicken our forests

en.fai_summon_nikharul_description: Use the power of the Dark Crystal to harness Nikharul to our will forever
en.fai_temple_mirune_description: The temple in the forest is dedicated to Mirune the woods goddess. Let's clean it up and pay homage to her
en.fai_temple_ritual_description: A simple ritual at the temple
en.fai_the_aid_description: More and more refugees are asking to enter the city, now it has become a big crowd

en.fai_warrior_gods_description: Paladins chosen by the Gods join us
en.fai_underground_tunnel_f_description: We have to explore the Underground Tunnel
en.fai_zenix_aid_description: Zenix in return for our hospitality could teach his arts to our young strategists making some a formidable aid in battle
en.fai_zenix_archmage_description: Zenix focus on Mana instead of Gold. Choose Wisely
en.fai_zenix_funder_description: Zenix focus on Gold instead of Mana. Choose Wisely
en.fai_zenix_master_description: Zenix focus on production instead of training troops. Choose Wisely
en.fai_zenix_trainer_description: Zenix focus on training troops instead of production. Choose Wisely
en.img_annhilator_description: In a moment of sheer desperation, as the forces of Theresmore teetered on the brink of annihilation, humanity resorted to its most terrifying creation: the Annihilator. This device, forged from the darkest depths of both arcane and technological knowledge, was their final gambit a weapon of unimaginable power, designed to erase the pervasive evil that threatened to engulf their world. When the Annihilator was activated, the heavens themselves seemed to shudder. A cataclysmic explosion of light and energy ripped through the Abyss, tearing apart the shadows that had suffocated the land. For a heartbeat, it appeared that the tides had turned, that salvation was within reach. The darkness shrieked and recoiled, disintegrating under the immense force unleashed. But the victory was a cruel illusion. As the Annihilators power reached its zenith, it tore a rift in the very fabric of reality. The ground shook violently, and the sky twisted into unnatural shapes as a gaping black hole began to form at the epicenter of the blast. This void, born from the recklessness of desperation, began to consume everything in its path. Terror spread like wildfire as the black hole expanded, pulling cities, forests, mountains everything into its inescapable maw. The people of Theresmore, once so valiant and determined, could do nothing but watch in horror as their world was devoured. The land was rent asunder, oceans drained into the abyss, and the very air was sucked away, leaving behind only an oppressive silence. In their final moments, as the last remnants of civilization were torn apart, the folly of their actions became painfully clear. The Annihilator, meant to be their deliverance, had instead become their executioner. The unstoppable force they had unleashed now erased all that they had fought to protect. Theresmore was no more. Where once there had been life and light, now there was only a cold, dark void silent, eternal testament to the hubris of those who dared to wield powers beyond their control. The world they had known, the lives they had lived, were lost to the black hole, leaving nothing but an empty expanse of darkness where hope had once flourished
en.img_army_description: Theresmore is full of dangers, and as we leave our valley we will discover that we are not alone. Enemies of all kinds are lurking and that is why we must arm ourselves and be ready to face them. In addition we can now create our own scouts who will explore Theresmore looking for anything we can exploit or conquer
en.img_army_of_dragon_description: Our valiant soldiers tightened their ranks once again to give battle. The old man's prophecy was correct, the Dragon was here to claim his artifact. His draconic servants hurled themselves on the walls with impetuousness but our defenses withstood the impact and gave battle without quarter. The Dragon, annoyed by these insolent humans who had the audacity to stand up to his army, pounced on the walls, mowing down and incinerating anyone who came within range. This was a grave mistake, because so close he was prey to the counterattack of our soldiers who managed to wound him and pierce the delicate membranes of his wings. Seeing himself hunted he took a leap and flew away before it was too late. His army was defeated and the city was saved. For now
en.img_army_of_goblin_description: Your soldiers knew that what had destroyed the village of Canava was waiting to spring at our throats, and that night they were not taken by surprise. From their defensive positions they lured the goblin wolfriders into an ambush quickly decimating them, the green skins hesitant from the loss of their cavalry abandoned their hiding places and were easy prey for our valiant soldiers. The goblin overlord leading the raid was pierced by a spear and now his head parades as a gruesome trophy through the streets of our settlement. We have won and our civilization is safe for now
en.img_ascension_description: As a mortal you transcend your flesh and a stream of knowledge invades you. The gods are ready to speak to you and you can live among them. They will send angels to Theresmore to help your people and the new leaders who will come to rule
en.img_astronomy: The birth of the third era
en.img_astronomy_description: We leave the feudal age and our gaze shifts to the firmament. It is the abode of the gods, and studying its movements will make us develop the scientific process. Theresmore still has much to offer, and this age will bring new machines and new ways to give battle. In addition, the progress of faith will know its highest points
en.img_barbarian_horde_description: "You have enslaved my people who by right should live free, you have shed the blood of my brothers and now I will shed yours. Prepare yourselves for war!"
en.img_baron_mordecai_description: The light emanating from the city's central plaza pierced through the Abyss, illuminating kilometers of darkness until it reached the domains of Baron Mordecai, a high vampire and sovereign of the Abyssal lands. His reaction was swift and filled with wrathful indignation.'How dare you, insolent mortals of the light, dare to encroach upon my realm and desecrate our world with your abominable radiance! Return to the pitiful lands from whence you came, or I shall personally see to it that every single human in the Abyss meets a gruesome end'. With a regal wave of his hand, Mordecai's legions, dark and formidable, began their relentless march toward the human outpost. Their singular goal was to obliterate the trespassers and their beacons of light, reclaiming the Abyss for the forces of darkness. The air grew heavy with impending doom as the shadows themselves seemed to rally under the vampire lord's command.
en.img_citadel_dead_description: Our scouts entered a mountain gorge and came across an old citadel. As far as the eye could see, its inhabitants haunted the area transformed into zombies and ghouls. In the area, wyverns have nested, which feeding on the unfortunates have created a thriving colony. In the heart of the citadel, familiar wrens have been glimpsed, it looks like Natronite, we must investigate!
en.img_colony_description: Brave settlers, embark on a journey to uncharted lands beyond the horizon. A new frontier awaits, a place of untold mysteries and untold riches, where the gods themselves will test your mettle. Stand tall and face whatever challenges may come, for this is a journey unlike any other. A tale of daring and bravery, a saga that will be told for generations to come. So gather your strength, sharpen your swords, and set sail into the unknown. The future of your civilization rests upon your shoulders, and with the grace of the gods, you shall conquer and thrive in this new world!
en.img_dark_knight_lord_description: This is the land of my lord who gives me this castle. You intruders and invaders have no right to dwell in these sacred places, and your pathetic settlement is an insult to the one who rules the abyss. You shall be purified!
en.img_deep_mine_description: Our miners are digging in the depths of Theresmore, and the deeper we descend, the more eerie noises can be heard coming from the abyss. Continuing to dig could be very dangerous
en.img_demoness_castle_description: "How dare you have defiled my village and freed my slaves from their eternal pleasure? And now you approach my castle! Don't you dare take another step or you will become my docile puppet"
en.img_elder_dragon: The Tyrant of Ash and Fire
en.img_elder_dragon_description: Azrathis, the Flamebinder, stood amidst the infernal glow, his form wreathed in living flame. His eyes burned with ancient, forbidden power as he raised his hands, commanding the fire to bend to his will. The air around him warped, thick with the heat of his dark magics. Beside him, Vaelgoroth, the Crimson Doom, unfurled its massive wings, casting shadows over the battlefield. Its obsidian scales gleamed with an eerie fire, and its breath was the furnace of death itself.Once, Vaelgoroth had unleashed destruction upon Theresmore, laying waste to its lands and cities in an inferno of rage. But it had been defeateddriven back into the depths of the world. Now, it had been resurrected, its power amplified by Azrathiss twisted magic, and it was far more terrible than before. Together, they were a storm of destruction, one a master of arcane flame, the other a living force of natures wrath. Their eyes met their enemies with cold contempt, knowing that nothing in this world could stop them
en.img_ending: Theresmore is safe once and for all?
en.img_ending_description: And thus, the legend of Theresmore reaches its end. The book of this world, its pages filled with triumph and tragedy, now closes upon an age of blood and sacrifice. The final words have been etched in fate, and the heroes names will be remembered as long as time endures. Their deeds will echo through eternity, a testament to the indomitable spirit of those who stood against the darkness. Yet, as the last page turns and the world fades into silence, questions stir like ghosts in the night. The signal from beyond still pulses in the voida riddle unanswered, a call from realms unknown. The secrets of the cosmos remain hidden, their truths just beyond reach. Is this truly the final chapter? Or does a new story lie in wait, beyond the horizon of what we know? The book may be closed for now, but the echoes of Theresmore will never be silenced
en.img_enso_multitude_description: In the Far East there is a civilization that can rival us for primacy on Theresmore. They call themselves Enso, the enlightened ones, the very force of the universe. Their symbol is a circle, they have almond-shaped eyes and their complexion is yellowish. They invented gunpowder and their warriors are fierce in battle and swarm like a multitude over the unfortunate enemy armies. They keep vast stores of Natronite of which they are very jealous; perhaps it would be better to make friends with them
en.img_fallen_angel_army_1_description: Past eras have taught us how to be cautious. The Druid was a Fallen Angel eager to take possession of natronite and the new weapons it brings. He set up an army of demons to whom he entrusted state-of-the-art weapons. The assault against the city was lightning fast but, by all the gods, our soldiers know how to deal with these abominations and their feathered leader. The walls of our city are unbreakable and now the creepy, once holy demon lies torn apart on the battlefield
en.img_fallen_angel_army_2_description: The garrison of our city awaited the onslaught of demons. Infernal monsters crashed on our walls in wave after wave and were repulsed. The Fallen Angel ordered a final assault with his entire rear guard: demons of all sorts breathed fire and tried to tear apart helpless soldiers and civilians. Our ranks, however, did not yield to evil; with the same light that had unmasked the impostor Druid they reacted to the gloomy assault by driving the abominations of the underworld back into the mud. The Fallen Angel deprived of his wings lay dead on the battlefield. Theresmore WON!
en.img_feudalism: The birth of the second era
en.img_feudalism_description: From the ancient era we are ready to build tall spires and turn our village into a small town. Feudalism knocks at our doors with its knights in heavy armor. Let the second era of men begin
en.img_glorious_retirement_description: You have done so much for this kingdom and for your people, maybe it's time to retire to private life and let someone else begin the adventure again to do even more! THERESMORE!
en.img_hand_evil_description: Activating the Signal Machine unleashed a torrent of arcane energy, echoing through the Abyss and beyond. This immense surge of power drew the immediate attention of the Matriarch of all succubi, known as The Hand of Evil. With her legions in tow, she descended upon the human encampment with terrifying swiftness. Her presence was overwhelming, a figure of dark majesty and unrelenting malice. As she hovered above the outpost, her eyes blazed with fury and curiosity. 'How dare you, mortals, wield such power?' she hissed, her voice a blend of seduction and venom. 'You have provoked forces far beyond your comprehension. How have you found and harnessed such might?' The sky darkened as her legions surrounded the camp, a menacing swarm of succubi ready to obliterate the intruders. The Hand of Evil's question hung in the air, a challenge and a threat. The humans, bolstered by their newfound technology and the presence of Archmage Zenix, braced themselves for the onslaught, knowing they had unleashed a power that had shaken the very foundations of the Abyss
en.img_holy_fury_description: The gods have given us battle angels, as beautiful to see as they are terrible on the battlefield. With them we will dominate Theresmore
en.img_king_kobold_nation: The King of Kobold declares war!
en.img_king_kobold_nation_description: Who would have imagined that these little beings could be so socially evolved? All the Kobolds of Theresmore united under their king are coming out from underground to attack us!
en.img_kobu_dominion_r_description: The halls hum to life as the last piece of the crystalline structure is restored. Previously undiscernible doorways open, leading to lifts that connect to other levels deep within the earth. The entirety of the Kobu Dominion is contained within this structure. They have mechanical bodies and their technology is nearly unfathomable. Its fortunate that they no longer have any desire for war
en.img_lich_fortress: The Fortress of Nikharul, the Soul Stealer
en.img_lich_fortress_description: As the scout venture deeper into the underground, he is suddenly confronted by an awe-inspiring sight. Before him stands a colossal fortress, its walls towering high into the air, gleaming ominously in the darkness. The massive structure seems to have been carved out of the very bedrock itself, with a sinister energy pulsing from every stone. As he approach the fortress, the scout can see that the battlements are manned by an army of the undead, numbering in the thousands. The creatures are led by Nikharul, the soul stealer, a powerful lich with a burning hatred for the living. His eyes blaze with an otherworldly light, and the air around him crackles with dark energy. Nikharul stands at the forefront of the fortress, his skeletal hands clasped together as he gazes out over the battlefield. His face is twisted with a cruel smile, and his eyes gleam with a malevolent joy. He is eager to unleash his army upon the world, to spread chaos and death to all those who stand in his way
en.img_magic_description: Since ancient times, our predecessors have relied on the gods for grace and help. Their prayers generated the faith so pleasing to the higher beings who command us. They released the Mana on Theresmore so that every person could feel it and honor it. Magic is an essential part of our nation, and mastering it will enable us to gain immense benefits
en.img_markanat_forest_description: The abode of Markanat, a mighty and enormous spider who guards his flooded forest. Its strength is immense, capable of crushing scores of men. Fame and glory await us if we can defeat him
en.img_marketplace_description: The market is the beating heart of our village. From now on merchants from all over Theresmore will be able to sell and buy livestock and goods of all kinds, as we continue to develop this area we will be able to turn it into a fair and thus be able to let this continent know the value of our goods
en.img_mana_engine_description: Our savants have discovered how to create machines that run on mana. It combines with saltpetre and creates an unstable resource: natronite. With it our civilization enters a new era of mechanics and prodigies, will we manage not to turn Theresmore into a huge cauldron of production? Will we maintain our attachment to the earth and Mother Nature? Welcome to the Fourth Age!
en.img_mindless_evil_boss_description: In the depths of the Abyss, the final confrontation with the Mindless Evil began. The combined forces of humanity and their elven allies stood resolute, their hearts steeled by the hard-won victories over Baron Mordecai and the Matriarch. United by a shared purpose and an unbreakable spirit, they prepared to face the ultimate darkness. As the battle commenced, a palpable tension filled the air. Darkness thicker than any night enveloped the battlefield, threatening to extinguish all light and hope. The Mindless Evil, an amorphous entity of pure chaos and hatred, moved with a terrifying, fluid grace. Its presence warped reality, casting a shadow over the bravest of souls. But the defenders of Theresmore stood undaunted. With honor and courage, they charged into the fray, their weapons and spells blazing with determination. Human warriors and elven archers fought side by side, their efforts synchronized in a dance of defiance against the encroaching darkness. Spells of light and fire clashed against the void, each flare a testament to their indomitable will. In the heart of the battle, heroes emerged. Human knights, clad in gleaming armor, led fearless charges, their battle cries echoing through the Abyss. Elven mages, their hands weaving intricate spells, cast protective barriers and devastating attacks. Every strike, every spell, every sacrifice was made in the name of preserving their world. Despite the overwhelming odds, they pressed on. Blood soaked the battlefield, and the cries of the wounded and dying filled the air, yet none faltered. The luminous beacons that illuminated their path shone brighter, fueled by their unwavering resolve. The bond between human and elf grew stronger with each passing moment, a unity forged in the crucible of battle. In a climactic moment, Archmage Zenix and the elven high priestess combined their formidable powers, creating a surge of energy that struck at the very heart of the Mindless Evil. The darkness writhed and shrieked as the combined might of magic and valor tore through its core. The sacrifices of the fallen and the relentless courage of the living converged in a final, decisive blow. As the Mindless Evil dissipated into nothingness, a triumphant cheer rose from the survivors. The battlefield, once a place of despair, now resonated with the echoes of victory. The great cities of Theresmore, saved from the brink of annihilation, would remember this day for generations. The heroes, both human and elf, stood tall amidst the wreckage. Their honor, courage, and sacrifice had not been in vain. They had faced the abyss and emerged victorious, proving that even in the darkest of times, the light of hope and unity could prevail. The tales of their valor would be sung for centuries, a testament to the enduring spirit of Theresmore
en.img_nightdale_protectorate_description: In the far, cold north a group of barbarian tribes have banded together to become a kingdom that endures the inhospitable climate. They are famous and valiant warriors and excel in iron forging. In perpetual struggle with the barbarians of the barren lands they protect the Northern Star, a powerful artifact located in the perennial ice
en.img_orc_horde_boss_description: As the final assault of the orc horde approached, the humans braced themselves for the imminent battle. Their fortified walls rose tall and proud, a symbol of the strength and determination of their people. But the orcs, fueled by their barbaric rage, were relentless. They stormed the ramparts, their howls of fury echoing across the battlefield. The humans fought with all their might, wielding the power of their technology to crush the orcish invaders. The clash of steel against steel and the roar of magic filled the air as the two armies clashed in a struggle for survival. But in the end, the humans emerged victorious, their bravery and cunning proving to be the decisive factor. The last remnants of the orcish warriors were scattered and Theresmore was safe once again, its people rejoicing in the triumph of their heroes. The winds of victory carried their cheers to the skies, a testament to the unbreakable spirit of humanity
en.img_reactivate_portal_description: By reactivating the portal you have created a conduit to the realm of the dead, the skeleton king's unstoppable army is waiting to devastate Theresmore, it must be stopped before it is too late
en.img_sssarkat_empire_description: In the warm waters beyond the realm of Zultan are salamander-like creatures that live mostly underwater. They are repositories of a vanished ancient civilization and populate its ruins by making use of remaining technology. They often visit the mainland and some of their villages can be found on the sunny shores
en.img_scalerock_tribes_description: In the high peaks of the Scalerock Mountains, there are tribes of draconians. They live in caves carved into the rock and fly over the high peaks to swoop down on their unsuspecting enemies. Descendants of dragons have retained their intelligence and craftsmanship in creating objects. They know natronite, perhaps from an ancestral legacy, and are greedy for it beyond measure
en.img_skullface_encampment_description: Skullface is the leader of the bandits in the region. Despite being a danger to the economic stability of our settlement he is a charismatic and cunning leader
en.img_start_description: From nomadic hunters and gatherers, our people have grown up and are ready to settle in a fertile valley. From here will arise, perhaps, the greatest nation Theresmore has known. The age of man has just begun
en.img_strange_encounter_description: But with caution we must proceed, for these woodland beings are a mystery, shrouded in whispers and tales passed down through generations. Their fleet-footed grace and deadly accuracy with the bow are but a mere glimpse of their mastery over the forests. The settlers' encounter is a historic moment, a chance for our civilization to reach out and make contact with a new race. So, let us approach with respect, openness, and diplomacy. For who knows what gifts of knowledge, resources, and friendship these elusive creatures may bring to our growing colony
en.img_the_portal_description: After defeating the Evil mist, humans and elves had to create a portal to reach the source from which the evil emanatedan abyss of pure darkness and malevolence. The creation of the portal was an intricate process, combining elven magical prowess and human technological ingenuity. As the portal took shape, an eerie coldness radiated from it, casting an aura of frost and foreboding over the surroundings. Once the portal was stabilized, a combined force of humans and elves ventured into the abyss, their hearts and minds steeled against the palpable malevolence that surrounded them. The darkness was absolute, swallowing every trace of light. It was a realm devoid of hope, an embodiment of the very evil they sought to confront
en.img_theresmore_richest_nation_descriptio: Our merchants range in every corner of Theresmore, our warehouses are dripping with gold, and there is no one who cannot be bought or subjugated by our economy
en.img_theresmore_wanders_description: In the steppes of the east, the inhabitants continue to be nomads. Their camps stretch for miles, they exploit the region's resources and then move on, looking for a new place to settle. Formidable on horseback they use their mobility to carry out raids on neighboring kingdoms. Often unreliable, they rule the largest pastures all over Theresmore
en.img_vampire_lair_description: Sitting on a pile of bones in her hiding place here is the vampire appearing. Eyes red as fire, raven wings pitch black. She would be a beautiful woman if only her power were not used to feed on humans. The General assures that we can defeat her but at what cost?
en.img_western_kingdom_description: The glory of the west, Theresmore's most advanced kingdom. Its castles can be seen from miles away and their cities are rich and bustling. On the battlefield they use their heavy cavalry that shakes the earth and makes enemies tremble. They possess the accesses to the western sea, the only true maritime outlet for all who inhabit this continent
en.img_zultan_emirate_description: Several autonomous city-states flourish in the sunny sands of the south. They answer to the great Emir of Zultan, the most powerful of these metropolises. A people developed in the most inhospitable lands of Theresmore and flourished through trade reaching every part of the continent. They protect the flame of Atamar who is said to have founded the city of Zultan
en.leg_ancient_treasury_description: An aid to minds and pockets
en.leg_angel_description: A holy warrior who fights for men
en.leg_cartomancer_description: In the cards a stream of luck
en.leg_cpt_galliard_story_description: Unlock the Story of Captain Galliard
en.leg_charism_description: Your name will be spoken more often
en.leg_clairvoyant_description: He know where the luck rest
en.leg_coin_mercenary_description: Unlock the Canava Guard mercenary unit
en.leg_craftmen_II_description: Are you having trouble with supplies?
en.leg_deep_pockets_description: Pockets to store a lot of gold
en.leg_elysian_field_description: The gods give us a Theresmore paradise
en.leg_elysian_field_II_description: Let's enlarge and guard the paradise
en.leg_enhanced_axes_II_description: Even better axes for our lumberjacks
en.leg_enhanced_pickaxes_II_description: Even better pickaxes for our miners
en.leg_free_hands_II_description: Even more population! This is the way!
en.leg_gift_nature_description: Nature provides us with abundant resources
en.leg_hall_wisdom_description: Hall of research from the past
en.leg_heirloom_contract_description: Hidden in the Monument enhances its strength
en.leg_heirloom_death_description: Hidden in the Monument enhances its strength
en.leg_heirloom_horseshoes_description: Hidden in the Monument enhances its strength
en.leg_heirloom_momento_description: Hidden in the Monument enhances its strength
en.leg_heirloom_wealth_description: Hidden in the Monument enhances its strength
en.leg_heirloom_wisdom_description: Hidden in the Monument enhances its strength
en.leg_irrigation_techniques_II_description: Even better technique for more food
en.leg_ministry_interior_l_description: Unlock the Ministry, for research and logistic
en.leg_ministry_war_l_description: Unlock the Ministry, for army and power
en.leg_ministry_worship_l_description: Unlock the Ministry, for magic and faith
en.leg_machines_gods_description: The production machines of the gods
en.leg_mercenary_agreements_description: The power of coins to create a lethal mercenary army

en.log_bui_1_beacon_light: With the construction of the first Beacon of Light, humans had established an outpost in the realm of true evil. Howling winds echoed beyond the aura of the Beacon, and those who dared venture beyond its protective light never returned. The agonized cries of the damned haunted the new human encampment day and night, inflicting madness upon its inhabitants in this surreal place steeped in malevolence

en.log_bui_12_colony_hall: Some isolated farms in the colony have been looted and burned. The slain settlers had horrendous wounds inflicted with great force; no children were found
en.log_bui_15_colony_hall: Our colony is the pride of all Theresmore. Let's build a wonder to celebrate it!
en.log_bui_1_containment_cell: The Eons Crystal remained confined within its containment chamber, and its power began to repair the genomes of all nearby elves. The growing curiosity among humans for this immensely powerful artifact spread across continents as news of a magical stone capable of bestowing power upon those who approached it circulated widely
en.log_bui_2_containment_cell: As humans were drawn to the power of the artifact, they began to tap into its source. The crystal crackled and surged with energy, almost feeding on human curiosity and greed. It altered the human DNA, bestowing longevity upon those fortunate enough to touch it. Long queues and processions were organized in an attempt to manage the situation within legal boundaries, but tension grew and unrest escalated. Over time, the crystal started to undergo a transformation, changing its colors. The once radiant and pure crystal now flickered with hues of darkness, reflecting the corrupted influence it had absorbed from human desires
en.log_bui_3_containment_cell: Driven by their insatiable thirst for power, the humans continued to exploit the crystal, leading to its corruption. One fateful day, the crystal unleashed a surge of black lightning, instantly claiming the lives of hundreds of people who were desperately attempting to touch it. Witnessing the catastrophic event, elven mages rushed to the scene, hoping to contain and neutralize the newfound power emanating from the artifact. However, their valiant efforts were in vain, as they, too, were incinerated in an instant by the uncontrollable energy

en.log_ene_ettin_enslaver: Our scout discovered an Ettin tribe trading in slaves
en.log_ene_explore_desert: Our scout discovered the south desert of elven myths
en.log_ene_fire_mage_domain: Our scout discovered the domain of a fire mage in the southern desert
en.log_ene_hell_hole: Our scout discovered an entrance to the underworld, demons patrol the cave and the horrors we will find there will be unimaginable. Warning!
en.log_ene_loot: Your scout returned to the settlement and brought back everything he could find
en.log_ene_loots: Your scouts returned to the settlement and brought back everything they could find
en.log_ene_no_loot: Your scout explored the territories for days but came back empty handed
en.log_ene_no_loots: Your scouts explored the territories for days but came back empty handed
en.log_ene_bandit_camp: Our scout discovered an encampment of bandits. By knocking it out we can eliminate the threat to our farmers and merchants
en.log_ene_basilisk_cave: Our scout discovered a cave of basilisks, beware of their petrifying gaze
en.log_ene_black_mage_tower: Our scout discovered a black tower inhabited by a large group of goblins together with their master
en.log_ene_cave_bats: Our scout discovered a cave full of vampire bats
en.log_ene_circle_necromancer: Our scout discovered a Circle of Necromancer
en.log_ene_far_west_island: Our scout discovered a tiny island a few days' sail to the west
en.log_ene_fire_elemental_circle: Our scout discovered the Fire elemental circle!
en.log_ene_forgotten_shelter: Our scout discovered the Forgotten Shelter of Captain Galliard!
en.log_ene_frost_elemental_circle: Our scout discovered the Frost elemental circle!
en.log_ene_fire_salamander_nest: Our scout discovered a nest full of fire salamander, beware the flames!
en.log_ene_gloomy_werewolf_forest: Our scout discovered the forest of the legendary monster Werewolf
en.log_ene_giant_temple: Our scout discovered a giant temple in the forest
en.log_ene_goblin_lair: Our scout discovered a lair of goblins, we will have to chase away these fetid creatures and occupy their territories
